page.title: 02LAND USE PATTERNS
page.content: The reason for the land-use patterns described on page 1 are not clear. The market gardening area seem to be part of a much larger area extending beyond the block to Wickham and southwards into the west of Fareham. It may be linked to the proximety of the large cities of Southampton and Portsmouth or to the historical location of strawberry farming in this area, a similarly labour intensive system of farming. Market gardening within the study area does seem to be restricted to the soils developed on the Bagshot Sands and certainly the farmers in the rest of the area frequently complained about poor drainage due to the underlying London Clay.
